pages.text:
April 2025 County of Marin EMS C 10
RETURN OF SPONTANEOUS
CIRCULATION (ROSC)
Indications
The presence of a palpable pulse and/or blood pressure for at least 30 seconds after cardiac
arrest
ALS RMC
• Maintain SpO2 94-99%
• ETCO2 if available
• Avoid excessive ventilation. Start at 10-12 breaths/
min and titrate to target ETCO2 35-40
• 12-lead EKG
• Early notification if STEMI
• Elevate head 30° if patient is conscious
• Transport to nearest available SRC
SPECIAL
If SBP <90
CONSIDERATION
• Administer NS 1L bolus IV/IO
Critical Information Reversible Causes
• If no improvement:
Hypovolemia
Treatment of hypotension Push-dose Epinephrine
Hypoxia
with push-dose • Mix 1ml Epinephrine Hydrogen Ion (Acidosis)
Epinephrine should take (0.1mg/ml concentration) with
Hypo/Hyperkalemia
precedence over use of 9ml NS in a10ml syringe
Hypothermia
atropine for treatment of • Administer Push-dose
Tension Pneumothorax
bradycardia during Epinephrine 1ml IV/IO
Tamponade (cardiac)
ROSC • Repeat every 3-5 min
Toxins
• Titrate to maintain SBP >90
Thrombus
• Monitor BP every 5 minutes
Trauma
